nodes.text: There is a risk that you are being asked to make an unauthorised payment.  No matter how small the amount, facilitation payments are illegal in most countries in which we operate and UK law forbids them anywhere in the world.  Even if not deliberate, making facilitation payments can seriously damage our reputation.
You should strongly resist any demand for this kind of payment. Say no and use the following to help you challenge the fee.
Remain calm and be prepared to wait.  Showing impatience can increase pressure to pay.  Use any or all of these statements to help you explain why you won't pay.
Remain courteous, respectful and if possible friendly
Make it clear that your company does not allow you to make irregular, non-standard or unofficial payments of any kind
Ask for name and official title of person asking and any identity number
State that you would need an official receipt if you were to pay the fee
Ask to speak to the supervisor/manager of the person making the demand to discuss why you cant pay
Mention that you will contact the embassy / consulate to discuss / report the issue
Explain that you must call your company first to report the issue and to get permission to pay the fee
Take notes or make mental note of the conversations and the time and place for a later report
